title: How many NaNoWriMo projects have been turned into published books? - Quora

response.answer_text: Heya, thanks for the A2A. I don’t have an exact answer for you unfortunately, I don’t even know if there is a record of that, or how many writers would own up to it. I do know there is some, every year NaNo sends you little pep talks from authors, and some of them are NaNo’ers themselves, and wrote their book during NaNo, or started it, or edited it. I have yet to actually finish any of my NaNo projects, which means that I can’t have any of them published. (Maybe one day). I will say, that writing during NaNo is only the start of writing a book to be published. Once it's written you have to edit and revise, and edit and revise, and edit and revise, did I mention revising and editing? So the end product may not be what the writer had at the end of NaNo. Hope this answered your question kinda!

Speaking for myself - four with one more in rewrite. I use the month of November to DUMP a novel’s prose out of my head into my computer, let it alone for December and start rewrite on New Years Day. My current work, ONE TOO MANY PHOTOS, is nearing its last major editing pass. I’ll release it after the first of the year.
